intro: Cathartolinum carteri, commonly known as the Carter's cathartolinum, is a rare and lesser-known plant species native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Violaceae and is characterized by its delicate, violet-hued flowers and lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories, where it thrives in partial to full shade. Its botanical significance lies in its unique floral structure and potential ecological role in its native habitat. Due to its rarity, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
